intro: Tetracera guilleminii, commonly known as the Guillemin's tetracera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
